title: make docker fails
body:
#### Expected behaviour
it will compile and work as expected

#### Actual behaviour
#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
1. Download the latest release
2. wget https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/archive/refs/tags/v2022.07.04.tar.gz
3. untar it `tar -xf erigon-2022.06.01.tar.gz`
4. get into the docker and make it 
```
cd erigon-2022.06.01
make docker
```
error:
```
Not a git repository
make: *** [Makefile:148: git-submodules] Error 1
```

if I make it a git repo by initializing it:
```
git init
```

the error is a bit different:
```
make docker                                                                                                                                               <aws:gemini>
Updating git submodules
fatal: ambiguous argument 'HEAD': unknown revision or path not in the working tree.
Use '--' to separate paths from revisions, like this:
'git <command> [<revision>...] -- [<file>...]'
```

This issue is stale because it has been open for 40 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment, or this will be closed in 7 days.
